entry.content:
WebAppUninstallAndReplaceJob is always run within the scope of a parent

WebAppCommand including its AppLock. By using raw_ref with dangling

pointer detection this helps verify the lifetime scoping is as expected.

entry.title: inputs: ensure client focused before insert
entry.content:
Currently this feature will not insert text correctly when the webui

instructs it to. This is because the input where the text should be

inserted is not focused. This CL fixes this issue by ensuring we wait

for the webui to close, and for the focus to return to the previous

input before completing the text insertion.



BUG=b:289859230

entry.title: [Extensions] Expand kill-URL protection on extension navigations
entry.content:
This CL expands the checks we do on URLs passed through to some

extension APIs which lead to navigations to cover more debug URLs which

can crash or hang the browser.



It also hoists the JavaScript URL protections (that were previously only

applied to chrome.tabs.update) up into the PrepareURLForNavigation

function so it applies to all callers that go through this path. This

includes chrome.tabs.create and chrome.windows.create as the two main

ones.



Bug: b/286217616

Change-Id: Ia2936756174350d11ea8e5be8e9828fae447694e

entry.title: LayoutNG: Store LayoutOverflow in PhysicalFragmentRareData
entry.content:
This CL changes the handling of LayoutOverflow.

* Store LayoutOverflow in PhysicalFragmentRareData

* Do not clone NGPhysicalBoxFragments on updating LayoutOverflow



The `updated_layout_overflow` argument of CloneWithPostLayoutFragments()

is not used after this CL.



This CL has no user-visible behavior changes, but the new code is

guarded by a runtime flag just in case.

entry.title: [customize-chrome][cr2023] Establish dependencies of features in code
entry.content:
Chrome Refresh requires the Customize Chrome side panel. This CL ensures

that Chrome Refresh is only enabled if Customize Chrome is enabled, too.



Additionally, this CL introduces a new feature flag that disables Chrome

Refresh even if Customize Chrome is enabled. This allows us to set up a

holdback experiment for the Customize Chrome side panel where both

experiment arms have Chrome Refresh disabled.



Things to note:

* Only some Omnibox features need to be gated by Customize Chrome. This

CL adds a helper to gate those specific call sites. The helper lives

in //components/omnibox/common to work around cyclic dependency

issues. This CL modifies DEPS rules accordingly.

* This CL moves ntp_features into a new GN target so that users can

depend on it in isolation. This, too, works around cyclic dependency

issues.



Bug: 1457991

Change-Id: I13ccb0df1cfa433aa5e10bc2bca5a7933913da6d

entry.title: Allow manually upload enterprise profile report
entry.content:
Make upload report button on chrome://policy page support profile

reporting.



The button now will be available when either browser or profile report

is enabled by the enterprise policy.



Once the button is clicked, both reports will be triggered. The button

will remain disabled state until upload tasks for both reports are

finished.

entry.title: graphite: Enable DXGI shared handle in D3D11VideoDecoder
entry.content:
Enable the use of DXGI shared handles in D3D11VideoDecoder when running

Graphite or if the D3D11VideoDecoderUseSharedHandle feature is enabled,

both of which are experimental.



Also disable texture arrays when using shared handles since Dawn doesn't

support importing those as external images. This is more useful than the

current behavior where shared handles are used, but the video frame is

not Dawn/WebGPU compatible if a texture array ends up being used.



Bug: chromium:1236801, chromium:1464274, dawn:1932

entry.title: Clean up ForceLayoutForPagination().
entry.content:
There aren't really a lot of interesting things to do if there's no

LayoutView, so just return early.



Avoid duplicate code at the end of the function. As a "side-effect" of

this, we'll now heckle the text auto-sizer also if we ended up scaling

the viewport in order to avoid inline overflow. Not expecting this to

make any difference at all, but this should be more consistent, if

nothing else.

entry.title: Bump cr23_*_gtests test suites to 10% experiment on main builders.
entry.content:
This effective adds the cr23_browser_tests, cr23_unit_tests,

and cr23_interactive_ui_tests suites to the main builders

('Linux Tests', 'Mac12 Tests', 'Win10 Tests x64' and so on)

as 10% experiments, but not the CQ builders

(i.e., these are 'ci_only').



Note that these are the *full* test suites, and not the

cr23_regressed_* test suites, which will only run on the fyi

bots.



This affects quite a few bots:

entry.title: [Extensions] Remove BrowserContextID type from some member functions.
entry.content:
ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter declares an alias to std::uintptr_t to

avoid storing pointers in some maps. This type is used by some functions

that are called by other classes, but this is really an implementation

detail and shouldn't be exposed to external callers. This CL changes

those function signatures to pass in the pointer to the BrowserContext

instance, then internally converts it to BrowserContextID.



It also changes one member function's signature to pass the pointer to

the BrowserContext as the first parameter, making it consistent with

most others.



Bug: 1433136

Change-Id: I5fe7c5e1689f00310d3137ebf528655b730553fe

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Change MapToOriginalUrl to take NavigationHandle
entry.content:
Change MapToOriginalUrl to take a NavigationHandle instead of a

WebContents. This is a step towards removing the need to use WebContents

for PDF Viewer setup.



Currently, the PDF Viewer architecture relies on using WebContents to

launch the PDF Viewer. This is fine with GuestView PDF Viewer, since

each GuestView has its own WebContents, but the OOPIF PDF Viewer project

will change it to only use one WebContents. If a page has multiple PDF

Viewers embedded, they will share the same WebContents, which may cause

collisions if the PDF Viewer continues to rely on WebContents.



Additionally, future non-MimeHandler code needs access to the

NavigationHandle to retrieve the destination URL and the parent frame.



There should be no change in behavior.



Bug: 1445746

entry.title: Redo AmbientControllerTest.ShouldDismissScreenSaverPreviewOnTouch.
entry.content:
It fails when TimeOfDay is default enabled, but it's not really

because of TimeOfDay. It comes down to the fact that the video

screen saver can start rendering immediately, whereas the slide

show screen saver must wait for photos to be downloaded. The test

case was not waiting for the ambient ui to start rendering:

* Ambient session is started

* PressTouch

* Ambient session is closed

* Ambient session starts again somehow

* ReleaseTouch

* Ambient session closes again



This sequence is unrealistic. It requires a user to exit ambient

mode by touching the screen, hold their finger on

the screen the entire time, and while doing so, somehow relaunch

ambient mode, then release their finger afterwards. Even if that

somehow happens, it's not clear that the intended behavior is for

the release to trigger ambient session closing again. It does not

work for video because this happens instead:

* Ambient session is launched

* Ambient widget/window is created

* PressTouch

* Ambient widget/window is closed

* Ambient session is closed

* A TOUCH_CANCELED is automatically generated since the PressTouch

closed the widget while the widget was still active.

* Ambient session starts again somehow.

* ReleaseTouch.

* The GestureRecognizer deep in the ui code does not publish

the ReleaseTouch to the AmbientController because the original

PressTouch event was canceled previously when the widget was

destroyed.



The fix is to give the test a realistic sequence of events and

make sure that touching the screen exits ambient mode while it

is preparing photos and while it is rendering.



Bug: b:292294050

Change-Id: Idb696016a8a4864232fc95d9039435cc69023d61

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4713674

entry.title: Ash: Fix DCHECK when moving an ADW to a new display
entry.content:
This change fixes a DCHECK that happens when per-desk z-order is enabled

and an all-desk window is moved from one display to another. It fixes it

in the sense that it wasn't really handled at all before.



The general approach taken here is to detect when an all-desk window is

moved between displays. When this happens, the controller is notified

and it will in turn notify all desks that this is happening. This lets

all desks remove and add ADW data as needed.



The unit test harness has been updated to handle moving windows from one

display to another.

entry.title: [VC] better index of stop_callbacks in MediaStreamCaptureIndicator.
entry.content:
Current Problem:

currently the stop_callback stored in the ediaStreamCaptureIndicator::WebContentsDeviceUsage keyed by device_id.



Because the device_id is not unique, there are at least two problems

with this:

(1) the stop_callback can be easily overwritten by another capturing

that captures the same device. This happens for both getUserMedia and

getDisplayMedia.



(2) when there is both audio_device and video_device, it is hard to

decide which/what id to use.





a global index can solve both problems.



Solution:

A g_stop_callback_id is used to uniquely identify each stop_callback.

Each MediaStreamCaptureIndicator::UIDelegate gets its own unique

stop_callback_id from g_stop_callback_id and used when adding and removing devices.

entry.title: Fix SharedDictionaryStorageInMemory issue
entry.content:
There is a bug that SharedDictionaryStorageInMemory can't override an

existing dictionary. This is because SharedDictionaryStorageInMemory::

OnDictionaryWritten() method is using std::map's insert() method to

insert a new dictionary to `dictionary_info_map_`. std::map's insert()

doesn't insert a new element if the map contains an element with the

same key. To fix this issue, this CL changes OnDictionaryWritten()

method to use insert_or_assign() method.



Bug: 1413922

entry.title: [Live Caption] Explicitly start/stop system live captions at startup.
entry.content:
Expose the current number of streams from CrasAudioHandler (without

triggering a DBus), and then check the number of streams when SODA

becomes available, and start recognizing.



This allows System Live Captions to be enabled during video playback

and start immediately recognizing as appropriate, rather than waiting

for a pause/restart.



AX-Relnotes: Improves System Live Captions at startup.

entry.title: Revert "[3pp] Implement 3pp for chromium/build/fuchsia/"
entry.content:
This reverts commit b94ce175f4b5ead78e54e2c4110f6e7de9164fef.



Reason for revert: break internal builder because build/ is double referred by devtools.



Original change's description:

> [3pp] Implement 3pp for chromium/build/fuchsia/

>

> It uploads the content into the chromium/fuchsia/test-scripts cipd

> package, so it can be used to share with other repos.

>

> Unlike other implementations, `latest` returns the sha256 of the files

> in the archive so that it can ignore most of the chromium changes but

> focus only on the changes in the desired folder.

>

> A TODO is to remove the irrelevant files from the cipd package, but it

> is less important.

>

> The 3pp should be automatically picked up by

> https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/3pp-linux-amd64-packager.

>

> FYI: 3pp is a system to upload packages to the cipd, since manual

> uploading is disallowed.

> https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/HEAD/docs/cipd_and_3pp.md

>

> Change-Id: I8e61569064fd74fd17d5c6e0c7c3c06b031b7bcb

entry.title: [Test Automation] Make ElementIdentifier debug output more consistent
entry.content:
Printing the address of the ElementIdentifier implementation struct was

useful when these systems were new, but provides no additional

information now that the system is mature.



On the other hand, since the identifier is printed out in error

messages, including an arbitrary address can confuse LUCI clustering.



This CL removes the address so that instead of ElementIdentifier

printing to the debug stream as

"ElementIdentifier ABCD1234ABCD1234 [kMyIdentifier]"

They will print simply as:

ElementIdentifier kMyIdentifier



Change-Id: I52a92eb44045c48e514ed12819006b42011a907d

entry.title: Make it possible to debug rustc invocations through rustc_wrapper
entry.content:
Now that SOURCES are in the .rsp file, when you run ninja with

`-d keeprsp -d keepdepfile` the command you see invoked by ninja can't

be run again afterward by you.



The rustc_wrapper strips the SOURCES from the rsp file before invoking

rustc (necessarily), but that means the next time you run rustc_wrapper

it complains that SOURCES are not present.



To avoid this, have rustc_wrapper write to a different rsp file, and

clean it up after, to preserve the one generated by GN. This way I

was able to do:



ninja -v -d keeprsp -d keepdepfile out rust_gtest_interop_unittests



To see the command being executed for the

rust_gtest_interop_unittests_rust_objects crate, and then run it

myself but replace `--emit=...` with `--emit=llvm-ir` and

`-o ...rlib` with `-o ir.txt` in order to see the LLVM IR

generated.



Bug: 1466674

Change-Id: I35c848e7d79641fe351443c92fc91306eef9eadb

entry.title: [StartRefactor] Allow tab switcher returns to Start surface.
entry.content:
With "start surface refactor" is enabled, tapping the back button on

the tab switcher always shows the last active tab, even if the tab

switcher was opened from clicking the tab count button on the Start

surface. In this CL, we change this behaviour to allow the tab

switcher return to the start surface:

1. The supplier of LayoutStateProvider is plumbed to

TabSwitcherMediator. It allows the TabSwitcherMediator to track

the last active layout type before the Grid tab switcher is

showing. It won't handle the back operations if it needs to

return to the START_SURFACE layout with refactor is enabled.

2. ReturnToChromeBackPressHandler handles the case to reshow the

START_SURFACE layout if TabSwitcherMediator doesn't.

3. The LayoutMangerImpl is plumbed to TabSwitcherLayout. This allows

the TabSwitcherLayout track whether the next layout to show is the

START_SURFACE layout. We skip tab expanding animation when the

TabSwitcherLayout is hiding in this case.

Demo:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yw2u_7LSV-SRzo3oJcno__Whg5KtIYd1/view?usp=drive_link





Bug: 1464317

Change-Id: I7734aa81fc17d2cf3bd6a9a9a35da24f6eb2b3ae

entry.title: [layout] Don't mess with margins for alignment/RTL purposes.
entry.content:
Previously in block layout we'd adjust margins for text-align purposes

and for obtaining the correct line-left offset for RTL.



This resulted in the margins we'd store to be incorrect. Instead of

adjusting the margins account for alignment/RTL with an additional

offset instead.

entry.title: [ChromeRefresh2023] Extend tab shape when tabs are small to fit favicon.
entry.content:
In CR23, the tab separator and tab separator margins are increasing for

visual appeal, but in the minimum tab width scenario, too much space was

being taken from the tab contents in order to render separation. To fix

this, the separation is reduced to 1 px when small tabs are needed. This

occurs when the contents region shrinks to less than the size of a

favicon.

entry.title: Fix lifetime issue
entry.content:
https://crrev.com/c/4633989 fixed an issue where a null string would

crash. However, while creating a null-check, it moved a string

variable inside the null-checked block, causing a dangling pointer.



This moves the ownership of the string outside the null-checked block,

resolving the issue.

entry.title: shapedetection: Remove calling into NOTREACHED when SkImage is null
entry.content:
This CL removes the use of NOTREACHED when the SkImage returned from

image sources PaintImageForCurrentFrame().GetSwSkImage() is null.

Instead, an exception will be thrown. This is because there is a

legitimate case where the SkImage could be null, such as if there is an

underlying system error that prevents a connection from being

established to the GPU process.

entry.title: [ntp] Fix collection image fetch for NtpBackgroundImageErrorDetection
entry.content:
Currently, a collection's images are only fetched if another collection image fetch is not in progress. This is determined by whether or not `requested_collection_id_` is set. Accordingly, we should clear `requested_collection_id_`'s value each time a collection image info fetch completes.



Note that clearing `requested_collection_id_` directly in NtpBackgroundService::OnCollectionImageInfoFetchComplete can create a race condition where another request can be started before all the images are verified, if the NtpBackgroundImageErrorDetection experiment is enabled (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/search/background/ntp_background_service.cc;drc=57bfe0755c0fad94ee6c1d3a715a4b56a8a59e76;l=261).



Change-Id: I073fb846dd739229e66abf3919e26e740e871ce2

Bug: 1459242

entry.title: Stop reporting Attribution parsing issues in internal UI
entry.content:
Registrations alongside navigations and fenced frame reports are

processed in the browser process.



Since, https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4678398

, parsing errors from the browser are reported as devtools issues. These

issues are therefore currently reported twice: as Devtools issues and in

the attribution internal UI.



With this CL, we stop reporting these issues in the attribution internal

UI.



This means that parsing errors are now consistently and only reported

as Devtools issues whether they arise in blink or the browser.



Bug: 1423951

entry.title: certificate_tag: user-friendly tag strings, validation, set cert only
entry.content:
This CL makes the following changes to the `certificate_tag` utility:

* Allow passing in the tag as a string. The tag no longer accepts

hex-encoded strings, and should not include the magic string

`Gact2.0Omaha`.



Example:

`certificate_tag.exe --set-superfluous-cert-tag="appguid=foo" Set.exe`



* Allow printing a human readable tag string via `--get-tag-string`.



Example:

`certificate_tag.exe --get-tag-string Set.exe`

Prints:

`"appguid=foo"`



* Allow setting only the certificate with the magic string without a

tag.



Example:

`certificate_tag.exe --set-superfluous-cert-tag Set.exe`



* Validate the tag before writing it.



Example:

`certificate_tag.exe --set-superfluous-cert-tag="appgaid=foo" Set.exe`



Prints:

`Tag string is invalid: appgaid=foo`



Bug: 1465914

Change-Id: Ic41a8a9737f46240ae04e36b6e65d74842c15a9f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4717850
